name: Lavender Hill Cob
description: Though it may seem demure, lavender should be handled with a delicate touch in drinks lest it overpower other ingredients. Here, gently deployed, it lends its gorgeous floral flavor and aroma to a tall, icy and refreshing cobbler. A small measure of crème de violette deepens the floral nature of this drink and adds a faint purplish haze. (The name honors the brilliant Ealing Studios comedy, "The Lavender Hill Mob," starring Alec Guinness).
keywords: crème de violette, edible flower, gin, lavender, lemon

recipeInstructions.text: Muddle lavender and lemon with simple syrup in a highball glass. Add gin and crème de violette and stir. Fill glass with crushed ice. Top with soda water. Garnish with flowers.
